userreviews.userReview: Oh Em Gee to coin another author's phrase I absolutely loved this introduction into a new series from Davis and Adrienne. I cannot wait until i can learn more about this Dark Scales Division that Owen is a part of, at the moment he is working undercover to find a psychopath by the name of Liam Huff. He rents a place right next door to the woman who will become his mate. Not the best timing for finding one's mate but who says fate works the way you want it. Nadia and her sister Sage are having a sister week before Sage is off to college. Nadia and Owen hit it off right away then Sage gets kidnapped by Huff.That is just how this story starts. I like it a lot Snow and Courtney members of Owen's team sound like interesting dragons to get to know better so I am looking forward to more stories. I highly recommend this to all my dragon loving friends.I voluntarily read an advance copy and have not been compensated in any way for this opinion. But judge it for yourself I think you'll like it.
Pretty good start to the new series - fast-paced, a lot happens, characters are intriguing and you will be captivated by what is going on, as every page bring something NEW!

A great read, sexy man, lakes, dragons and steamy times. Im becoming a fan of the work of Lia Davis, she produces well defined storylines with characters that you can immediately take to and mainly believe in. She seems to get to the point of the story with no needless waffle Filling out more chapters than is actually needed to give you a story. The realism of the emotions the characters go through are done really well. You are able to feel the desperation, action, passion, secrets, lies, grief And suspense as you read along. The world building in this book is a world we live in ( apart from dragon shifters of course) and again easy to relate to. This is the third book I have read from this author and all of them have included steamy sex scenes, so if you are offended by this kind of storyline then this book isn’t for you. However there are some great storylines in her books, this one is a strong independent woman, who knows her own mind, in desperate search of her missing sister. She won’t allow to be treated as a weak willed female, she dives into the emotional draining search for her sister, then has to deal with the man she had an immediate connection to, and starting to fall in love with, admitting he is a dragon shifter. I recommend you read this book and find out how this storyline starts and finishes with fireworks at both ends and some simmering moments in between. I will definitely be looking forward to reading more of Lia Davis other books.

Could not get enough of this new dragon shifter world loving the Dark Scales Division.... emotionally thrilling, sexy, engaging, action packed romantic adventure filled with mystery, danger and red hot passion..... what more could a reader want?Owen Ashton is the sexy hot alpha of the DSD and is on the trail of a serial killer that murdered his sister. Nadia Hasting is vacationing at a lake house in Minnesota with her sister Sage on their first vacation after their parents death and not expecting the eye candy next door.... Loved the banter and page turning adventure they share, could not put it down once I started reading...

It has been a minute since I have got to read a book by either of these authors but combined was a quick get into the cover of this one. Really enjoying dragon shifters with this one being special by being in a special unit that investigates is the bonus here. When Owen is in a case he also gets a bit of a surprise with whom he meets. Nadia is also going to have a surprise with her neighbor but the two of them together will need each other in more ways than one. The drama is swift and the story is quick over too soon. One thing is for sure I hope the next one that comes out of this series is longer to enjoy.

This is the first in the Dark Scales Division series. I can see so many promising books in the future for this series. I have read Lia Davis’s book before, so I knew it would be good. I was not disappointed. I haven't read Kerry Adrienne before, but I plan to check for other works. This book kept me on the edge of my seat. So much is happening, it just flies by, which is good but bad all at the same time. Some of the storyline was pretty predictable, enjoyable to read but still predictable. I wish there was a few curve balls thrown in, nothing too major, just to make you wonder and keep you guessing. Overall, its a solid story and I can't wait until there are more in the series.

What happens when you mix a shifter romance with a serial murder investigation? Read Dragon Undercover and find out. In my opinion dragon shifter and team lead for DSD—Dark Scales Division—Owen Ashton and his team should never have been on this case to start with. They were too close to it. But I guess it kept them motivated and it did allow Owen to meet his mate. Nadia is smart and responsible and stronger than she knows. This story is filled with love, loss, duty and determination. I look forward to getting better acquainted with the team. Fun action and romance.

Dragon Undercover book one of Dark Scales Division by Lia Davis and Kerry Adrienne is wonderful. The characters are totally hot and sexy. The dragons are amazing. The first book is short but has everything you need for a new series. Kerry and Lia did a terrific job introducing their new series and characters. This new series features dragons that work for the Dragon Counsel protecting the world from rogue dragons. I can't wait to see where the series takes us. I received an ARC from Netgalley. This is my voluntary honest review.

Overall rating: 4.5 (KU copy)This story sure read fast! The author wasted no time getting these characters into the action. The outcome made sense. You have to be prepared for a quick read when picking up this book. I did find myself wondering about a few things when I was done but that is the perfect place for a reader to be....wondering about what will come in the next book. This voluntary review is based against a Kindle Unlimited copy.

Do you like Dragons? Do you like action and adventure? Romance? A fast paced, quick read? Then this new series is for you. Special task force, undercover work, kidnappings and surprise mate, what more could you want in a story? I enjoyed getting to know Nadia and Owen and learning their story. I was intrigued by the other members of the special team as well. Looking forward to see what the future of this series brings about.

Very enjoyable fast paced story. I do however wished that there were a little bit more built up between Nadia and Owen. I just felt like things happen so fast between them. Overall a entertaining read plenty of intrigue, action, and of course steamy. Great start for a new series. I voluntarily read and review this ARC no monetary compensation was received the opinions I have expressed are my own.

This was a fun book. I feel like it moved a bit too quickly, but thankfully I could still feel and appreciate the connection of the characters. I think the story idea was great and I did really like the characters and their stories. Their connection was genuine and I liked them together. I think it’s a great start to a series and look forward to the next book.

There are timed Owen doesn't like giving in to his woman, "he made that growling sound again, only this time, it was deeper, like it came from his chest. “Then you are wearing Kevlar. And shoes. That’s not optional..." I loved this book, I fell in love with Owen the man was protective, possessive, and caring.

Now, normally I don't like shifter books but I decided to give this one a try. I decided to try a few pages and before I knew it I had devoured the entire book. This book flowed so easily I didn't realise I had read the entire thing until I had turned the last page. Wow!! Will definitely be following this author from now on.

If you like a fast paced read with romantic and adventure Then this is a book for you. The story line for the MC's is admired. I would of personally liked a bit more build up for the MC's characters to be more defined and the romance. But that is just a personal preference

Great beginning to a new series. Compelling characters and engaging story well written and well edited. Nadia and Owen are the first mated pair of this team and the tragedy that unites them all is brought to closure by their combined abilities. I look forward to more stories in this series

A very good start to a new series. It’s an entertaining read with dragons , humans ,Trouble ,kidnapping and mates all making this an exciting book.Loved it looking forward to next in series.Voluntarily reviewed this advance copy.

Dragon Undercover is an enjoyable start to a new series! I’m a fan of shifter stories, and Dragons are a favorite! Soooo happy we got an HEA and not a cliffhanger! Will definitely read the next installment!

Loved the story line. Owen and Nadia had chemistry that was hot. The story was great from beginning to end. He was undercover and she was on vacation but didn't know the danger that lurked in the shadows. Can he keep his promise to her. read it and find out

I was given a copy of this book for an honest review.Wow! This book was a hot start to a new Dragon series. I really enjoyed the action and romance in this book. It's a great introduction to the Dark Scales Division. I can't wait for the next book and to get to know more of the team.

I loved this book dragon shifter Owen is searching for a killer. The dragon killed his sister. His team is helping but he goes to a lake to search. The DSD has its own rules ! Nadia and Sage are on vacation before Sage goes to college there lives are about to change Lia Davis has away of telling a story to make you feel you are right there looking into the eyes of a dragon

description:
"Lia Davis has away of telling a story to make you feel you are right there looking into the eyes of a dragon." -Kimberley, Goodreads Dragon shifter and team lead for DSD—Dark Scales Division—Owen Ashton has never lost a case. When his sister’s murderer turns serial killer, he is determined to take the rogue dragon down, for good. His team tracks the murderer to a small town in Minnesota and Owen goes undercover to finally end Huff’s reign of terror. The last thing Owen expected was to discover his mate vacationing in the lake house next to his.Nadia Hasting, along with her sister Sage, take the first vacation in years since their parents’ deaths. Visiting the lake house their family rented every year when they were children is exactly what they need for downtime before Sage heads to college. The hot neighbor is a bonus, but Nadia isn’t sure she’s ready to date. But the pull toward the sexy stranger proves too strong to ignore. When Sage goes missing, Nadia turns to Owen to rescue her sister from a mad man. But will Owen’s dragon scare her away from the one man that can save them all?
